intro: Manihot decurrens, commonly known as arrowleaf manioc, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which must be processed before the roots can be consumed. Its roots are a source of淀粉 (starch) and are used in various traditional foods. The plant also has potential applications in agriculture and medicine due to its adaptability and chemical composition.
